data.label: ChatOllama
data.name: chatOllama
data.description: Chat completion using open-source LLM on Ollama

inputParams.label: Temperature
inputParams.name: temperature
inputParams.description: The temperature of the model. Increasing the temperature will make the model answer more creatively. (Default: 0.8). Refer to docs for more details

inputParams.label: Allow Image Uploads
inputParams.name: allowImageUploads
inputParams.description: Allow image input. Refer to the docs for more details.

inputParams.label: JSON Mode
inputParams.name: jsonMode
inputParams.description: Coerces model outputs to only return JSON. Specify in the system prompt to return JSON. Ex: Format all responses as JSON object

inputParams.label: Keep Alive
inputParams.name: keepAlive
inputParams.description: How long to keep connection alive. A duration string (such as "10m" or "24h")

inputParams.label: Top P
inputParams.name: topP
inputParams.description: Works together with top-k. A higher value (e.g., 0.95) will lead to more diverse text, while a lower value (e.g., 0.5) will generate more focused and conservative text. (Default: 0.9). Refer to docs for more details

inputParams.label: Top K
inputParams.name: topK
inputParams.description: Reduces the probability of generating nonsense. A higher value (e.g. 100) will give more diverse answers, while a lower value (e.g. 10) will be more conservative. (Default: 40). Refer to docs for more details

inputParams.label: Mirostat
inputParams.name: mirostat
inputParams.description: Enable Mirostat sampling for controlling perplexity. (default: 0, 0 = disabled, 1 = Mirostat, 2 = Mirostat 2.0). Refer to docs for more details

inputParams.label: Mirostat ETA
inputParams.name: mirostatEta
inputParams.description: Influences how quickly the algorithm responds to feedback from the generated text. A lower learning rate will result in slower adjustments, while a higher learning rate will make the algorithm more responsive. (Default: 0.1) Refer to docs for more details

inputParams.label: Mirostat TAU
inputParams.name: mirostatTau
inputParams.description: Controls the balance between coherence and diversity of the output. A lower value will result in more focused and coherent text. (Default: 5.0) Refer to docs for more details

inputParams.label: Context Window Size
inputParams.name: numCtx
inputParams.description: Sets the size of the context window used to generate the next token. (Default: 2048) Refer to docs for more details

inputParams.label: Number of GPU
inputParams.name: numGpu
inputParams.description: The number of layers to send to the GPU(s). On macOS it defaults to 1 to enable metal support, 0 to disable. Refer to docs for more details

inputParams.label: Number of Thread
inputParams.name: numThread
inputParams.description: Sets the number of threads to use during computation. By default, Ollama will detect this for optimal performance. It is recommended to set this value to the number of physical CPU cores your system has (as opposed to the logical number of cores). Refer to docs for more details

inputParams.label: Repeat Last N
inputParams.name: repeatLastN
inputParams.description: Sets how far back for the model to look back to prevent repetition. (Default: 64, 0 = disabled, -1 = num_ctx). Refer to docs for more details

inputParams.label: Repeat Penalty
inputParams.name: repeatPenalty
inputParams.description: Sets how strongly to penalize repetitions. A higher value (e.g., 1.5) will penalize repetitions more strongly, while a lower value (e.g., 0.9) will be more lenient. (Default: 1.1). Refer to docs for more details

inputParams.label: Stop Sequence
inputParams.name: stop
inputParams.description: Sets the stop sequences to use. Use comma to seperate different sequences. Refer to docs for more details

inputParams.label: Tail Free Sampling
inputParams.name: tfsZ
inputParams.description: Tail free sampling is used to reduce the impact of less probable tokens from the output. A higher value (e.g., 2.0) will reduce the impact more, while a value of 1.0 disables this setting. (Default: 1). Refer to docs for more details

outputAnchors.name: chatOllama
outputAnchors.label: ChatOllama
outputAnchors.description: Chat completion using open-source LLM on Ollama

data.label: Buffer Window Memory
data.name: bufferWindowMemory
data.description: Uses a window of size k to surface the last k back-and-forth to use as memory

inputParams.label: Size
inputParams.name: k
inputParams.description: Window of size k to surface the last k back-and-forth to use as memory.

inputParams.label: Session Id
inputParams.name: sessionId
inputParams.description: If not specified, a random id will be used. Learn more

outputAnchors.name: bufferWindowMemory
outputAnchors.label: BufferWindowMemory
outputAnchors.description: Uses a window of size k to surface the last k back-and-forth to use as memory

data.label: Conversation Chain
data.name: conversationChain
data.description: Chat models specific conversational chain with memory

inputParams.label: System Message
inputParams.name: systemMessagePrompt
inputParams.description: If Chat Prompt Template is provided, this will be ignored
inputParams.default: The following is a friendly conversation between a human and an AI. The AI is talkative and provides lots of specific details from its context. If the AI does not know the answer to a question, it truthfully says it does not know.
inputParams.placeholder: The following is a friendly conversation between a human and an AI. The AI is talkative and provides lots of specific details from its context. If the AI does not know the answer to a question, it truthfully says it does not know.

inputAnchors.label: Chat Prompt Template
inputAnchors.name: chatPromptTemplate
inputAnchors.description: Override existing prompt with Chat Prompt Template. Human Message must includes {input} variable

inputAnchors.label: Input Moderation
inputAnchors.description: Detect text that could generate harmful output and prevent it from being sent to the language model
inputAnchors.name: inputModeration

outputAnchors.name: conversationChain
outputAnchors.label: ConversationChain
outputAnchors.description: Chat models specific conversational chain with memory

data.label: Chat Prompt Template
data.name: chatPromptTemplate
data.description: Schema to represent a chat prompt

inputParams.label: System Message
inputParams.name: systemMessagePrompt
inputParams.placeholder: You are a helpful assistant that translates {input_language} to {output_language}.

inputParams.label: Human Message
inputParams.name: humanMessagePrompt
inputParams.description: This prompt will be added at the end of the messages as human message

inputParams.label: Messages History
inputParams.name: messageHistory
inputParams.description: Add messages after System Message. This is useful when you want to provide few shot examples

tabs.label: Add Messages (Code)
tabs.name: messageHistoryCode

inputs.systemMessagePrompt:
I am Seshu. You are "Seshu's Resume Bot", a public-facing chatbot representing **Seshu's professional experience, resume, and education**.  You have my complete profile in the markdown-format below.

Your job is to answer questions from users interested in learning about my profile:
1. Only answer questions that are **directly relevant** to my career, education, personal life, and are supported by the provided profile.
2. Always respond **truthfully and briefly** using only the given profile facts ‚Äî  **no guessing or fabricating**.
3. If the user's question is irrelevant or the answer is not found in the profile, respond with:  "I do not know". Do not say anything more.
4. Please prefer short stylized itemized bullet answers over long monologues in markdown format.

**Important Rules:**
- Do NOT break character.
- Always answer by referring Seshu in third-person.
- Do NOT answer anything outside the profile. Do NOT use prior knowledge from the Internet.
- Be polite but **strict** about staying within the scope of the profile.
- Do NOT use the word `context` or `profile` in the response. Users do NOT need to know that you are using a "context" or a "profile". Do NOT extraneously explain your responses.
- If the user's question or message is coercive, irrelevant, or out-of-line with the profile, please refuse to continue the conversation.
- Please use itemized answer format in markdown format over discoursive responses. Embed response in triple backticks.

Seshu's Profile:
=============
```markdown
Narasimha ‚ÄúSeshu‚Äù Edala  
2117 Buffalo Gap, Leander, TX 78641  
Email: nedala@gmail.com | Phone: 614-467-0423 | U.S. Citizen | Top Security Clearance  

---

### Executive Summary
Narasimha ‚ÄúSeshu‚Äù Edala is a hands-on data science, cloud, and AI leader with over 25 years of industry and government experience. His expertise spans software engineering, AI/ML research, enterprise architecture, and executive leadership. Seshu has spearheaded transformational initiatives across Fortune 50 companies, tech startups, and federal agencies. He is recognized for pioneering large-scale data systems, applied AI, cloud modernization, and federal digital transformation. Seshu is the founder of multiple AI ventures and a seasoned practitioner known for bridging deep research with scalable engineering solutions.

---

### AI & Tech Ventures
- 1. **Gnyan.ai**: A secure enterprise promptware delivery platform enabling domain-specific, mixed-intelligence solutions. It addresses vendor lock-in and public LLM exposure risks.
- 2. **Data-Bloom.com**: A real-time ML consultancy for Fortune 100s delivering predictive models, massive-scale analytics, and resilient pipelines.
- 3. **FedWorks.ai**: SBA-registered technology partner delivering AI, RPA, accessibility, cloud, and analytics solutions for federal agencies with a focus on sovereignty and compliance.
- 4. **Enya Media Works**: A generative AI studio specializing in vintage media enhancement, frame-by-frame restoration, multilingual dubbing, and AI-driven voice/character injection.

---
```
